IRS990.MissionDesc: THE AQUARIUM'S MISSION IS TO MAINTAIN THE HIGHEST QUALITY AQUATIC AND MARINE SCIENCE PROGRAMS FOR RECREATION AND EDUCATION SO THAT THE PUBLIC BETTER UNDERSTANDS, CHERISHES, AND CONSERVES THE WORLD'S NATURAL MARINE AND COASTAL RESOURCES.
IRS990.Desc: MARINE LIFE EXHIBITIONS AND CARE - THE AQUARIUM MAINTAINS AND CARES FOR OVER 500 SPECIES OF ANIMALS IN STUNNING INDOOR AND OUTDOOR EXHIBITS AT ITS 30-ACRE MARINE FACILITY. SOME OF THE CURRENT EXHIBITS INCLUDE PASSAGES OF THE DEEP, SEALS AND SEA LIONS, JELLIES, SEA OTTERS, GIANT PACIFIC OCTOPUS, SEABIRD AVIARY, AND OTHERS. THE PRIMARY FUNCTION OF THE ANIMAL HUSBANDRY DEPARTMENT IS TO PROVIDE CARE AND A HEALTHY ENVIRONMENT FOR THE MARINE ANIMALS. THE DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ASPECTS OF ANIMAL HUSBANDRY, LIFE SUPPORT, REHABILITATION, ANIMAL COLLECTION, TRANSPORT AND ALL DIVE PROGRAMS ASSOCIATED WITH THE AQUARIUM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: VISITOR SERVICES AND MARKETING - THE AQUARIUM PROVIDES INFORMATION AND RELATED SERVICES TO VISITORS, STUDENTS, RESEARCHERS, SCHOLARS, AND OTHERS INTERESTED IN THE AQUARIUM'S EXHIBITS, PROGRAMS, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES. IN ADDITION, THE AQUARIUM CONDUCTS BROADER EFFORTS TO COMMUNICATE WITH THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT MARINE LIFE AND OREGON'S COASTAL ECOSYSTEMS, AND PROMOTE THE AQUARIUM'S EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATION AND OUTREACH - THE AQUARIUM OFFERS ONSITE, ONLINE AND OUTREACH EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THE AQUARIUM CREATES EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS, VIRTUAL FIELD TRIPS, CAREER SHADOWS AND OTHER VIRTUAL PROGRAMS. THE AQUARIUM PARTNERS WITH LINCOLN COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT (LCSD) ON AN OCEAN LITERACY INITIATIVE - POSTING TEACHER RESOURCES WITH GRADE-SPECIFIC LESSONS LINKED TO NATIONAL OCEANIC GUIDELINES AND STATE STANDARDS. ALSO WORKING WITH LCSD, THE AQUARIUM PILOTED A MODIFIED VERSION OF OUR YOUTH VOLUNTEER PROGRAM TO TRAIN BI-LINGUAL NATURAL HISTORY INTERPRETERS. ON-SITE THE AQUARIUM FACILITATES BEHIND-THE-SCENES TOURS AND SCHOOL FIELD TRIPS. FUNDED BY IMLS, THE AQUARIUM'S EDUCATORS USE ANIMAL "AMBASSADORS" TO TEACH VISITORS ABOUT COASTAL WILDLIFE, AND INSTILL EMPATHY TOWARD MISUNDERSTOOD SPECIES.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INVESTMENT RETURN ON THE ENDOWMENT IS FOR GENERAL OPERATIONS AND ADMISSIONS FOR FOSTER CHILDREN AND FAMILIES.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN LIFE ESTATE 2,117. NET CHANGE IN INTEREST IN ASSETS HELD BY THE OREGON COMMUNITY FOUNDATION -16,329.

FROM THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THE CHAIR SELECTS MEMBERS TO REVIEW THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CEO FOR THE LAST YEAR AS WELL AS THE COMPENSATION PACKAGE. THEY RESEARCH COMPARABLE SALARIES LOCALLY AND WITH OTHER AZA AQUARIUMS. THE AQUARIUM CONDUCTED A COMPENSATION REVIEW OF ITS MANAGEMENT AND OTHER STAFF IN AUGUST 2022 USING TWO MAIN SOURCES: THE 2021 AZA MEMBER COMPENSATION REPORT (AZA REPORT) AND THE CASCADE EMPLOYER'S ASSOCIATION 2022 REGIONAL PAY SURVEY WAGE REPORT (CASCADE EMPLOYER'S REPORT). GATHERED FROM HR IS THE CURRENT PACKAGE IN PLACE ALONG WITH THE HISTORY. ALSO PROVIDED FROM THE FINANCE DIRECTOR IS THE CURRENT YEAR'S BUDGET FOR COMPENSATION. AFTER A REVIEW OF THE FINANCIAL POSITION OF THE AQUARIUM AND DISCUSSION OF THE WORK LOAD THE CEO IS UNDER, CONSENSUS IS MADE ON A NEW PACKAGE WITH GOALS FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR. THE CHAIR REVIEWS IN PERSON WITH THE CEO ON THESE GOALS AND COMPENSATION.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: DANIEL LEWER, BOARD MEMBER, IS A CONTROLLING MEMBER OF THE HOSPITAL
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: WILLAMETTE VETERINARY HOSPITAL PROVIDES VETERINARY SERVICES TO OREGON COAST AQUARIUM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OREGON COAST AQUARIUM IS A PRIVATE, NONPROFIT AQUATIC AND MARINE SCIENCE EDUCATIONAL FACILITY OFFERING A FUN AND INTERESTING WAY TO LEARN ABOUT OREGON'S UNIQUE COASTAL ECOSYSTEM. SINCE IT OPENED ITS DOORS IN 1992, THE AQUARIUM HAS EDUCATED AND ENTERTAINED MILLIONS OF VISITORS TO THE CENTRAL OREGON COAST, AND HAS BEEN A MODEL FOR MARINE RESEARCH AND CONSERVATION. THE AQUARIUM IS DEDICATED TO TEACHING MARINE WILDLIFE AND OCEAN PRESERVATION THROUGH RESPONSIBLE MANAGEMENT AND EXHIBITION OF MARINE LIFE. OBJECTIVES OF THE AQUARIUM ARE TO DEVELOP AND PURSUE CONSERVATION, DEVELOP AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND RESEARCH PROGRAMS OF LOCAL AND GLOBAL SIGNIFICANCE, FOSTER AN AWARENESS AND APPRECIATION OF OREGON'S COASTAL ENVIRONMENT AND THE INTERDEPENDENCE OF OUR GLOBAL ECOSYSTEM, AND SERVE AS A COMMUNITY RESOURCE AND RECREATIONAL CENTER. IN 2016, THE OREGON COAST AQUARIUM EMBARKED ON A FIVE YEAR AGGRESSIVE AND NECESSARY CAPITAL CAMPAIGN TO RAISE $12.5 MILLION FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE FACILITY AND ANIMAL EXHIBITS. THE PROJECTS IDENTIFIED ARE TO: 1) BUILD A MARINE WILDLIFE REHABILITATION CENTER 2) ENHANCE THE GRAND HALL AND NATURE PLAY AREA (CONSTRUCTION BEGAN IN 2020) 3) RENOVATE EXISTING EXHIBIT GALLERIES (EXHIBITS IN PROGRESS) 4) EXPAND OUR OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM. THE COMPLETED FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND SUBMITTED TO THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS ARE REPORTED TO THE FULL BOARD AT EACH QUARTERLY MEETING. THE BOARD THEN VOTES ON WHETHER OR NOT TO ACCEPT THE TRANSACTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FROM THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THE CHAIR SELECTS MEMBERS TO REVIEW THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CEO FOR THE LAST YEAR AS WELL AS THE COMPENSATION PACKAGE. THEY RESEARCH COMPARABLE SALARIES LOCALLY AND WITH OTHER AZA AQUARIUMS. THE AQUARIUM CONDUCTED A COMPENSATION REVIEW OF ITS MANAGEMENT AND OTHER STAFF IN AUGUST 2022 USING TWO MAIN SOURCES: THE 2021 AZA MEMBER COMPENSATION REPORT (AZA REPORT) AND THE CASCADE EMPLOYER'S ASSOCIATION 2022 REGIONAL PAY SURVEY WAGE REPORT (CASCADE EMPLOYER'S REPORT). GATHERED FROM HR IS THE CURRENT PACKAGE IN PLACE ALONG WITH THE HISTORY. ALSO PROVIDED FROM THE FINANCE DIRECTOR IS THE CURRENT YEAR'S BUDGET FOR COMPENSATION. AFTER A REVIEW OF THE FINANCIAL POSITION OF THE AQUARIUM AND DISCUSSION OF THE WORK LOAD THE CEO IS UNDER, CONSENSUS IS MADE ON A NEW PACKAGE WITH GOALS FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR. THE CHAIR REVIEWS IN PERSON WITH THE CEO ON THESE GOALS AND COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
